
---
title: "AlbVirtualHost"
title_tag: "yandex.AlbVirtualHost"
meta_desc: "Documentation for the yandex.AlbVirtualHost resource with examples, input properties, output properties, lookup functions, and supporting types."
---



<!-- WARNING: this file was generated by Pulumi Docs Generator. -->
<!-- Do not edit by hand unless you're certain you know what you are doing! -->

Creates a virtual host that belongs to specified HTTP router and adds the specified routes to it. For more information,
see [the official documentation](https://cloud.yandex.com/en/docs/application-load-balancer/concepts/http-router).

{{% examples %}}

## Example Usage

{{< chooser language "typescript,python,go,csharp" / >}}





{{< example csharp >}}

```csharp
using Pulumi;
using Yandex = Pulumi.Yandex;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var my_virtual_host = new Yandex.AlbVirtualHost("my-virtual-host", new Yandex.AlbVirtualHostArgs
        {
            HttpRouterId = yandex_alb_http_router.My_router.Id,
            Routes = 
            {
                new Yandex.Inputs.AlbVirtualHostRouteArgs
                {
                    Name = "my-route",
                    HttpRoute = new Yandex.Inputs.AlbVirtualHostRouteHttpRouteArgs
                    {
                        HttpRouteAction = new Yandex.Inputs.AlbVirtualHostRouteHttpRouteHttpRouteActionArgs
                        {
                            BackendGroupId = yandex_alb_backend_group.My_bg.Id,
                            Timeout = "3s",
                        },
                    },
                },
            },
        });
    }

}
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example go >}}

```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-yandex/sdk/go/yandex"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := yandex.NewAlbVirtualHost(ctx, "my_virtual_host", &yandex.AlbVirtualHostArgs{
			HttpRouterId: pulumi.Any(yandex_alb_http_router.My - router.Id),
			Routes: yandex.AlbVirtualHostRouteArray{
				&yandex.AlbVirtualHostRouteArgs{
					Name: pulumi.String("my-route"),
					HttpRoute: &yandex.AlbVirtualHostRouteHttpRouteArgs{
						HttpRouteAction: &yandex.AlbVirtualHostRouteHttpRouteHttpRouteActionArgs{
							BackendGroupId: pulumi.Any(yandex_alb_backend_group.My - bg.Id),
							Timeout:        pulumi.String("3s"),
						},
					},
				},
			},
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example python >}}

```python
import pulumi
import pulumi_yandex as yandex

my_virtual_host = yandex.AlbVirtualHost("my-virtual-host",
    http_router_id=yandex_alb_http_router["my-router"]["id"],
    routes=[yandex.AlbVirtualHostRouteArgs(
        name="my-route",
        http_route=yandex.AlbVirtualHostRouteHttpRouteArgs(
            http_route_action=yandex.AlbVirtualHostRouteHttpRouteHttpRouteActionArgs(
                backend_group_id=yandex_alb_backend_group["my-bg"]["id"],
                timeout="3s",
            ),
        ),
    )])
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example typescript >}}


```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as yandex from "@pulumi/yandex";

const my_virtual_host = new yandex.AlbVirtualHost("my-virtual-host", {
    httpRouterId: yandex_alb_http_router["my-router"].id,
    routes: [{
        name: "my-route",
        httpRoute: {
            httpRouteAction: {
                backendGroupId: yandex_alb_backend_group["my-bg"].id,
                timeout: "3s",
            },
        },
    }],
});
```


{{< /example >}}

The AlbVirtualHost resource accepts the following [input]({{< relref "/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs" >}}) properties:

            title="Required">
        <span id="httprouterid_csharp">
<a href="#httprouterid_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Http<wbr>Router<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="authorities_csharp">
<a href="#authorities_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Authorities</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}A list of domains (host/authority header) that will be matched to this virtual host. Wildcard
hosts are supported in the form of '*.foo.com' or '*-bar.foo.com'. If not specified, all domains will be matched.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="modifyrequestheaders_csharp">

    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Apply the following modifications to the request
headers. The structure is documented below.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="modifyresponseheaders_csharp">

headers. The structure is documented below.

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>

            title="Optional">
        <span id="routes_csharp">
<a href="#routes_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Routes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#albvirtualhostroute">List&lt;Alb<wbr>Virtual<wbr>Host<wbr>Route<wbr>Args&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}A Route resource. Routes are matched *in-order*. Be careful when adding them to the end. For instance, having
http '/' match first makes all other routes unused. The structure is documented below.
{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>

        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}name of the route.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="routes_python">
<a href="#routes_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#albvirtualhostroute">Sequence[Alb<wbr>Virtual<wbr>Host<wbr>Route<wbr>Args]</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}A Route resource. Routes are matched *in-order*. Be careful when adding them to the end. For instance, having
http '/' match first makes all other routes unused. The structure is documented below.
{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_authorities_csharp">
<a href="#state_authorities_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Authorities</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}A list of domains (host/authority header) that will be matched to this virtual host. Wildcard
hosts are supported in the form of '*.foo.com' or '*-bar.foo.com'. If not specified, all domains will be matched.

    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">

## Supporting Types



<h4 id="albvirtualhostmodifyrequestheader">Alb<wbr>Virtual<wbr>Host<wbr>Modify<wbr>Request<wbr>Header</h4>

{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="append_csharp">
<a href="#append_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Append</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Append string to the header value.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="name_csharp">
<a href="#name_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>

<h4 id="albvirtualhostroutegrpcroutegrpcrouteaction">Alb<wbr>Virtual<wbr>Host<wbr>Route<wbr>Grpc<wbr>Route<wbr>Grpc<wbr>Route<wbr>Action</h4>

{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="backendgroupid_csharp">
<a href="#backendgroupid_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Backend<wbr>Group<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Backend group to route requests.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="autohostrewrite_csharp">
<a href="#autohostrewrite_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Auto<wbr>Host<wbr>Rewrite</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}If set, will automatically rewrite host.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostrewrite_csharp">
<a href="#hostrewrite_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Host<wbr>Rewrite</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Host rewrite specifier.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="idletimeout_csharp">
<a href="#idletimeout_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Idle<wbr>Timeout</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies the idle timeout (time without any data transfer for the active request) for the
route. It is useful for streaming scenarios - one should set idle_timeout to something meaningful and max_timeout
to the maximum time the stream is allowed to be alive. If not specified, there is no
per-route idle timeout.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="maxtimeout_csharp">
<a href="#maxtimeout_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Max<wbr>Timeout</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Lower timeout may be specified by the client (using grpc-timeout header). If not set, default is 
60 seconds.
{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

<h4 id="albvirtualhostroutehttproutehttprouteaction">Alb<wbr>Virtual<wbr>Host<wbr>Route<wbr>Http<wbr>Route<wbr>Http<wbr>Route<wbr>Action</h4>

{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="backendgroupid_csharp">
<a href="#backendgroupid_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Backend<wbr>Group<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Backend group to route requests.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="autohostrewrite_csharp">
<a href="#autohostrewrite_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Auto<wbr>Host<wbr>Rewrite</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}If set, will automatically rewrite host.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostrewrite_csharp">
<a href="#hostrewrite_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Host<wbr>Rewrite</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Host rewrite specifier.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="idletimeout_csharp">
<a href="#idletimeout_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Idle<wbr>Timeout</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies the idle timeout (time without any data transfer for the active request) for the
route. It is useful for streaming scenarios - one should set idle_timeout to something meaningful and max_timeout
to the maximum time the stream is allowed to be alive. If not specified, there is no
per-route idle timeout.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="prefixrewrite_csharp">
<a href="#prefixrewrite_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Prefix<wbr>Rewrite</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}If not empty, matched path prefix will be replaced by this value.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="timeout_csharp">
<a href="#timeout_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Timeout</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies the request timeout (overall time request processing is allowed to take) for the 
route. If not set, default is 60 seconds.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="upgradetypes_csharp">
<a href="#upgradetypes_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Upgrade<wbr>Types</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}List of upgrade types. Only specified upgrade types will be allowed. For example, 
"websocket".
{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

{{% choosable language go %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">

</span>

        <span class="property-type">string</span>

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies the request timeout (overall time request processing is allowed to take) for the 
route. If not set, default is 60 seconds.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="upgradetypes_go">
<a href="#upgradetypes_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Upgrade<wbr>Types</a>

            title="Optional">
        <span id="autohostrewrite_nodejs">
<a href="#autohostrewrite_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">auto<wbr>Host<wbr>Rewrite</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}If set, will automatically rewrite host.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostrewrite_nodejs">
<a href="#hostrewrite_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">host<wbr>Rewrite</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Host rewrite specifier.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="idletimeout_nodejs">
<a href="#idletimeout_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">idle<wbr>Timeout</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies the idle timeout (time without any data transfer for the active request) for the
route. It is useful for streaming scenarios - one should set idle_timeout to something meaningful and max_timeout
to the maximum time the stream is allowed to be alive. If not specified, there is no
per-route idle timeout.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="prefixrewrite_nodejs">
<a href="#prefixrewrite_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">prefix<wbr>Rewrite</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}If not empty, matched path prefix will be replaced by this value.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="timeout_nodejs">
<a href="#timeout_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">timeout</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies the request timeout (overall time request processing is allowed to take) for the 
route. If not set, default is 60 seconds.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="upgradetypes_nodejs">
<a href="#upgradetypes_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">upgrade<wbr>Types</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string[]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}List of upgrade types. Only specified upgrade types will be allowed. For example, 
"websocket".
{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

{{% choosable language python %}}

            title="Required">

        <span class="property-type">str</span>

        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies the request timeout (overall time request processing is allowed to take) for the

{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="upgrade_types_python">
<a href="#upgrade_types_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">upgrade_<wbr>types</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Sequence[str]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}List of upgrade types. Only specified upgrade types will be allowed. For example, 
"websocket".
{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Replace only matched prefix. Example:<br/> match:{ prefix_match: "/some" } <br/> 
redirect: { replace_prefix: "/other" } <br/> will redirect "/something" to "/otherthing".
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="replacescheme_csharp">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Replaces scheme. If the original scheme is `http` or `https`, will also remove the 
80 or 443 port, if present.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="responsecode_csharp">
<a href="#responsecode_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Response<wbr>Code</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The HTTP status code to use in the redirect response. Supported values are: 
moved_permanently, found, see_other, temporary_redirect, permanent_redirect.
{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

## Import


A virtual host can be imported using the `id` of the resource, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import yandex:index/albVirtualHost:AlbVirtualHost default virtual_host_id
```
